data.title: fix error msg in scene2dui ProgressBar
[Bullet] Turning debug on creates big amount of garbage
data.body:
When turning DrawWireframe debug on, it seems to generate a lot of btVector3 probably somewhere in native code, I have been unable to track exact spot. But the result is that gc steps in every few seconds and causes very noticeable pause.

I have copied code from libgdx's bullet tests, so the problem should be replicable there.

data.title: TextField does not lose focus when SelectBox is clicked and expanded.
fill out Decal with convenience methods
data.body: Also removed redundant axes vectors and replaced them with stock axes vectors.  Technically it is slightly less safe now as you can always mess up the values for Vector.X,Y,Z, but if you are doing that you have bigger problems.

data.title: Bugfix for AnimationController
data.body: When an animation has 0 seconds duration (it's still, not moving) the AnimationDesc.update() would hang indefinitely. This should make each frame consume 1 loop, though I'm not sure if this is the best way to handle this. What do you guys think?

data.title: ModelBuilder docs wrong
data.body:
On the javadocs of [ModelBuilder](http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/nightlies/docs/api/com/badlogic/gdx/graphics/g3d/utils/ModelBuilder.html) there's a line on the class description that says

> The part(String, int, VertexAttributes, Material) method will return a MeshPartBuilder which can be used to build the node part.

Although there's no such `part(String, int, VertexAttributes, Material)`, although there's a similar `part(String, int, long, Material)`

I'm not familiar with the 3D API of LibGDX (I started using it this month), I'm not sure if the docs or code is misleading (I bet docs are outdated), so I'm leaving this issue opened instead of sendind a PR this time.

data.title: iOS hardware keyboard isn't working
data.body:
I'm wondering if there is any special trick needed to enable an iOS bluetooth keyboard? My app works fine with a keyboard in the Android emulator, and fine on the Desktop.  

I have a customer reporting that their iPad plus bluetooth keyboard is not working. I don't have a keyboard for my iPad, but if if I:
1. start the iOS Simulator
2. choose Hardware -> Simulate Hardware Keyboard from the menu
3. type on the keyboard in my app

Nothing happens.   Doing the same thing on Android or the Desktop works as expected.

I'm using TouchUp/Down with GestureListener.

Let me know if I can provide more info. Thanks!

data.title: Vector2.Zero
data.body: Vector2.Zero constant is not equal to "new Vector2 (0, 0)". When printing (Vector2.Zero) print "[100.0:100.0]"

data.title: Request: a new shape framework
data.body:
In my opinion (and experience), refactoring shape classes in libGDX would simplify a lot of user code.
What I mean, is to provide a Shape interface which would be implemented by classes like Rectangle, Circle, Ellipse, Polygon, Polyline, etc.

This would find immediate utility in collision checking and eventual other user applications.

data.title: Added remove methods for lights.
data.body: Added some remove methods to the `Environment` so one doesn't have to know the internals of how the lights are managed by the `Environment`, when trying to remove them. They work exactly like the `add(...)` methods.

data.title: WebView as scene2d UI component?
data.body:
Hi,

Since WebView is quite powerful for html content displaying, and both android and ios have the same webkit core, not sure if scene2d UI could add a wrapper component for WebView? So developer can easily use the html ability to display formatted text and this feature also might be useful for some other scenarios ...

Thanks

data.title: Added ParticleEffect scaling.
data.body:
Added scaleEffect(float scaleFactor) to allow particle effect scaling.
All credit goes to **brendan** from LibGDX forums: http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=11599#p52184

data.title: ResolutionFileResolver supports DP and have different matching strategy
data.body:
Additions to [ResolutionFileResolver](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/assets/loaders/resolvers/ResolutionFileResolver.java) see issue #2161

now supports
- bestMatch: closest size to target screen
- higherMatch: smallest size larger than the target screen
- lowerMatch: largest size smaller than the target screen

Also added Density pixel resolution metric, match sizes based on screen density.

data.title: Can't turn off Stage debug rendering
data.body: I can turn it on just fine.  But when I try to turn it off (via `stage.setDebugAll(false)`), nothing happens.  It looks like the `stage.debug` field is never set to `false` anywhere.

data.title: ResolutionFileResolver best match policy is incorrect
data.body:
[ResolutionFileResolver](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/assets/loaders/resolvers/ResolutionFileResolver.java#L71) chooses the largest descriptor that is smaller than the current screen size

``` java
Resolution other = descriptors[i];
if (w >= other.portraitWidth && other.portraitWidth >= best.portraitWidth 
    && h >= other.portraitHeight && other.portraitHeight >= best.portraitHeight) 
        best = descriptors[i];
```

For example I'm providing 3 descriptors `480x800`, `800x1280`, and `1200x1920`. If the target device is Nexus 4 `768x1200` it's matched to `480x800`. I think it should be matched to `800x1280`. 

I think a good fix would be choosing the descriptor that have the smallest normalized difference form the target screen.

data.title: Matrix4's set (float[] values) efficency
data.body:
This isn't a real issue, however it may be actually more efficient to not use `System.arraycopy` to copy values over. I did a bench mark on my system, and it turns out that manually copying each value over to a new array in a for loop, may actually be faster. I think that it would be interesting if other people would run a benchmark on their systems as well, to see if it is actually faster, and post it here.

I am not posting my benchmarking program here, just in case I made a mistake or maybe it was the particular implementation that I was using, however the my benchmark indicated, over a large number of samples that hard copying over the values was about 1.2x faster than using `System.arraycopy`.

data.title: Cell.prefSize(float w, float h) sets the width param as both width and height
data.body:
It sets the width param as both width and height.

https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/db3b817cbcd5c9551fdfbb99567b754e336018be/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/scenes/scene2d/ui/Cell.java#L257

I'm avoiding using prefSize(w, h) and am using prefWidth(w).prefHeight(h) to get the desired effect.

data.title: do not let users add null inputprocessors to multiplexer
data.body: It's possible to accidentally add null processors, which will result in hard crashes with unhelpful errors messages

data.title: Made the map implementations Java 8 compliant.
data.body:
Using a JRE or JDK 8, the libgdx map implementations actually have a compile error. As an example:

> Duplicate methods named remove with the parameters () and () are inherited from the types `ObjectMap.MapIterator<K,V>` and `Iterator<ObjectMap.Entry<K,V>>`

This is the declaration of the class with the error:

```
static public class Entries<K, V> extends MapIterator<K, V> implements Iterable<Entry<K, V>>, Iterator<Entry<K, V>> {
```

That's because with Java 8 `Iterator` now also provides a default implementation for `remove()`. Since `MapIterator` also does that, there's a conflict. I resolved it by explicitly overriding the method in all classes which have this conflict and solve it by saying which one should be used, without using the Java 8 syntax to do so. That way it should still be compliant with Java 6 compilers, while at the same time supporting Java 8 compilers.

data.title: Meshbuilder
data.body: added methods to build with Meshes and added a test project for MeshBuilder

data.title: Table.drawDebug(Stage) consumes frequently memory
data.body:
When running my game (nothing added, just a table) and I activate debug via `myTable.debug()`, my RAM increases frequently. After 5 minutes the entire RAM has been consumed and the game doesn't respond anymore.

My system: Ubuntu 14.04 (LTS)

data.title: Compare versions correctly.
data.body: I'm done for today before I break everything!

data.title: Dont run afterEclipseImport if no desktop project, resolves #2134
Move or fork AndroidFragmentApplication from support.v4.Fragment to Fragment
data.body: I am glad there's support for a view-based approach to libgdx android, but given that SDK15 is already the minimum baseline for SDK support I'd like to ask for AndroidFragmentApplication to be moved from a support library Fragment to a base SD one. The reasoning behind it is that FragmentActivity and supportFragmentManager do not mix well both types of fragments, and add a lot of backwards compatible code that's will not be as demanded except for already available apps.

data.title: Enhance Shadow Quality
data.body:
The 3D shadow mapping results look pretty rough.
The currently only way to improve their quality is by increasing the shadowmap's FBO size. That though leads to crashes on weaker systems.
Please provide a possibility to increase shadow quality by using a soft shadow algorithm / shadow AA

data.title: ExtendViewport isn't centered with viewport.update()
data.body:
After creating an ExtendViewport and calling "viewport.update(width, height, true);" in resize(), the viewport stays anchored at the bottom left of the screen. Given the third "centerCamera" parameter in viewport.update(), I'd expect the viewport to be centered in the window.

Also found a forum post for this issue here: http://badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=14331

data.title: handle display creation failure for LWJGL
fbx-conv-lin64 Triangulates Every Other FbxMesh geometry
data.body:
The current fbx-conv-lin64 seems to be Triangulating every other FbxMesh Geometry. I have tested this with a blender file exported to a fbx file. The fbx file is correctly converted into G3DJ and G3DB files using an older version of fbx-conv-lin64, but the latest fbx-conv-lin64 only transfers every other Node-Parts. Can this be confirmed? --- fbx-conv versions:
  • fbx-conv-lin64 - version (Jul 19 2014) ---- Does not convert fbx file correctly
  • fbx-conv-lin64 - version (Oct 9 2013) ---- Converts fbx file correctly
3D Model Software:
  • blender - version (2.71)
Exported to:
  • FBX 6.1 ASCII
  • FBX 7.4 binary

data.title: Label has dobule overlapping text.
Reset scale and rotation values on simplified SpriteDrawable draw() call
data.body:
This fixes an issue that happens when scaling or rotating a SpriteDrawable wrapper (like Image) with a value different from default value (1 for scaling 0 for rotation) and then scaling/rotating it back to default value. The scale and rotation values of the Sprite don't get updated back to the default values.

It happens because the simplified/short draw call(), that doesn't change the scale and rotation of the Sprite, is usually used when the scale of the SpriteDrawable wrapper is 1 and the rotation 0 (see the draw() implementation of the Image class for instance).

To reproduce the issue, create an Image() with a SpriteDrawable, set the scale to 0.5, draw it and then set it back to 1. It will still be drawn as if it was scaled 0.5.

And as a nice side effect we reuse some code :)
